newsitem.title: USA: Top corporate lawyer earns over $3 million.
newsitem.headline: Top corporate lawyer earns over $3 million.

text.p: Viacom Inc.'s general counsel topped the list of the 100 highest paid corporate in-house lawyers with compensation of nearly $3.1 million in 1995, according to a survey.

The October issue of the American Lawyer's Corporate Counsel Magazine mailed this week reports that the median total cash compensation of the 100 general counsels on its chart rose to about $534,000 from about $500,000.
The chart shows that many of the legal counsel are being paid more because they are playing increasingly important roles in corporate management.

For example, Viacom Inc. General Counsel Philippe Dauman, who earned $3.06 million last year, was made deputy chairman in January when Chairman Sumner Redstone ousted Chief Executive Officer Frank Biondi Jr.
The second-highest paid legal officer on the chart was Merrill Lynch & Co.'s Stephen Hammerman, who earned $2.75 million. Hammerman is also vice-chairman of Merrill Lynch's board.
The magazine said the cash payments of both Dauman and Hammerman are nearly twice that of their nearest challenger, Time Warner Inc.'s Peter Haje, who earned $1.67 million.
However, Haje could have exercised options on the last day of fiscal 1995 and turned $12.2 million in profit, the magazine reported.

Other corporate counsel earning the most in cash compensation were Benjamin Heineman Jr. of General Electric Co., $1.57 million; Martin Coyle of TRW Inc., $1.56 million; Murrary Bring of Phillip Morris Cos. Inc., $1.3 million and Robert Mundheim of Salomon Inc., $1.14 million.
